alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:46AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Elbert, southeastern Hart, southwestern Laurens, southeastern Anderson, central Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1046 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Abbeville, or 5 miles east of Lake Secession, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laurens, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Due West, Iva, Lake Secession, Donalds, Cokesbury, Waterloo and Starr. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
